stephane.hdf5.h5py_convert¶

Store a dictionary into a hdf5 file Look recursively for any dictionary contained

Functions

convert(obj[, L, t])

Convert recursively an homemade class to a dictionnary.

create(filename)

display(Dict[, key])

example(filename)

example_2(filename, Dict[, key])

load(obj, data)

Load a h5py group into the attributes of obj.

load_dict(data)

Transform a h5py group into a dictionnary.

load_rec(data)

open(filename[, typ])

Open a hdf5 file.

write(obj[, erase, filename, key])

Write into a hdf5 file all the parameters recursively hdf5 file contains a dictionnary for each Class instance (e.g. Sdata, param, id) the parameters each individual is a dictionnary containing the attributes of the class + '__module__' and '__doc__' INPUT ----- obj : Class instance to be writen in json file. Attribute can be any type, numpy array are replaced by List. erase : bool, default False erase numpy array data before writing the json file. Prevent large json files OUTPUT ----- None.

write_rec(f, Dict[, key, group, t, tmax])

Write recursively a dictionnary into a h5py previously open file (f)

write_rec_terminal(f, Dict[, L, key, group, t])

Write recursively a dictionnary into a h5py previously open file (f)
